metadata.title: Evaluate to true if the oval-def:variable_component construct is properly supported
metadata.description: This definition is intended to evalutate to true if the interpreter properly supports the oval-def:variable_component construct.

criterion.comment: Test that the variable_object is supported with the var_ref attribute referencing an OVAL Variable that contains a single value.
Test that the variable_object is supported with the var_ref attribute referencing an OVAL Variable that contains multiple values.

variable_test.comment: Test that the variable_object is supported with the var_ref attribute referencing an OVAL Variable that contains a single value.
Test that the variable_object is supported with the var_ref attribute referencing an OVAL Variable that contains multiple values.

variable_object.comment: This variable_object represents a string value equal to 'Validation Test String'.
This variable_object represents the string values 'Validation Test String1', 'Validation Test String2', and 'Validation Test String3'.

variable_state.comment: This state represents a variable_object where the string value is equal to 'Validation Test String'.
This state represents a variable_object where the string value matches the regular expression 'Validation Test String[0-9]'.

constant_variable.comment: This variable represents the string value 'Validation Test String'.
This variable represents the string values 'Validation Test String1', 'Validation Test String2', and 'Validation Test String3'.

local_variable.comment: This variable represents the string value 'Validation Test String' but uses the variable_component construct to obtain the value.
This variable represents the string values 'Validation Test String1', 'Validation Test String2', and 'Validation Test String3' but uses the variable_component construct to obtain the values.
